p: In the uniform scenario, dispersal capacity (SM mean) had no effect on extinction risk, which was overall comparatively low. Small relative fitness differences here maintained fairly high levels of coexistence ( Fig 2A). For smaller SM, where all species moved sufficiently and in concert, the thermally best adapted species dominated, which caused a decline in evenness ( Î³ diversity). For larger SM, where regional dispersal was less efficient but local deposition probability was higher, local persistence and relative shifts in abundance according to thermal optima dominated, with a relatively lower loss of regional diversity ( Fig 2B).
